title: Vulvar disease
text:
A vulvar disease is a particular abnormal, pathological condition that affects part or all of the <a href="vulva">vulva</a>. Several <a href="pathology">pathologies</a> are defined. Some can be prevented by <a href="vulvovaginal%20health%20maintenance">vulvovaginal health maintenance</a>.
Vulvar cancer.
"Vulvar <a href="cancer">cancer</a>" accounts for about 5% of all gynecological cancers and typically affects women in later life. <a href="Five-year%20survival%20rates">Five-year survival rates</a> in the United States are around 70%.
Symptoms of vulvar cancer include itching, a lump or sore on the vulva which does not heal and/or grows larger, and sometimes discomfort/pain/swelling in the vulval area. Treatments include <a href="vulvectomy">vulvectomy</a> – removal of all or part of the vulva.
Vulvo-perineal localization of dermatologic disorders.
Systemic disorders may be localized in the vulvo-perineal region.
